title: P05-1039

sentences.text: In this paper , we present an unlexicalized parser for German which employs smoothing and suffix analysis to achieve a labelled bracket F-score of 76.2 , higher than previously reported results on the NEGRA corpus .
In addition to the high accuracy of the model , the use of smoothing in an unlexicalized parser allows us to better examine the interplay between smoothing and parsing results .

Entity-this_paper.label: this paper
Entity-this_paper.description: This paper presents an unlexicalized parser for the German language that utilizes smoothing and suffix analysis, achieving a labelled bracket F-score of 76.2, which surpasses previous results on the NEGRA corpus.

Entity-unlexicalized_parser_for_german.label: unlexicalized parser for German
Entity-unlexicalized_parser_for_german.description: The unlexicalized parser for German is a computational model designed for syntactic analysis of the German language that utilizes smoothing techniques and suffix analysis to improve parsing accuracy, achieving a labelled bracket F-score of 76.2 on the NEGRA corpus.

Entity-model.label: model
Entity-model.description: The 'model' refers to an unlexicalized parser for German that utilizes smoothing and suffix analysis to achieve high accuracy in parsing, specifically noted for its labelled bracket F-score of 76.2.

Entity-76.2.description: 76.2 refers to the labelled bracket F-score achieved by the unlexicalized parser for German in the study, indicating its performance level compared to previous results on the NEGRA corpus.

Entity-the_high_accuracy_of_the_model.label: the high accuracy of the model
aliases: the high accuracy of the model
Entity-the_high_accuracy_of_the_model.description: The high accuracy of the model refers to the effectiveness of the unlexicalized parser for German in achieving a labelled bracket F-score of 76.2, indicating its superior performance in parsing tasks compared to previous results.

mentions.local_name: the high accuracy of the model

Entity-suffix_analysis.label: suffix analysis
Entity-suffix_analysis.description: Suffix analysis is a linguistic technique used in the context of parsing, specifically in the development of an unlexicalized parser for German, to enhance the accuracy of parsing results.

Entity-smoothing_and_parsing_result.label: smoothing and parsing results
Entity-smoothing_and_parsing_result.description: The term 'smoothing and parsing results' refers to the outcomes and performance metrics obtained from applying smoothing techniques in an unlexicalized parser for German, specifically in relation to the accuracy and effectiveness of parsing tasks.

Entity-smoothing.label: smoothing
Entity-smoothing.description: Smoothing refers to a statistical method used in the context of an unlexicalized parser for German to improve the accuracy of parsing results by mitigating the effects of data sparsity.

Entity-smoothing_and_suffix_analysis.label: smoothing and suffix analysis
Entity-smoothing_and_suffix_analysis.description: Smoothing and suffix analysis refers to a technique used in natural language processing, particularly in the context of parsing, that enhances the performance of an unlexicalized parser by addressing issues related to data sparsity and morphological variations in language.

Entity-unlexicalized_parser.label: unlexicalized parser
Entity-unlexicalized_parser.description: An unlexicalized parser is a type of computational model used in natural language processing that analyzes sentence structure without relying on specific lexical items, focusing instead on syntactic patterns and grammatical rules.

Entity-german.label: German
Entity-german.description: German refers to the German language, which is the subject of an unlexicalized parser discussed in the paper.

Entity-interplay_between_smoothing_and_p.label: interplay between smoothing and parsing results
aliases: interplay between smoothing and parsing results
Entity-interplay_between_smoothing_and_p.description: The 'interplay between smoothing and parsing results' refers to the relationship and effects observed when applying smoothing techniques in an unlexicalized parser, specifically how these techniques influence the accuracy and performance of parsing outcomes.

mentions.local_name: interplay between smoothing and parsing results

Entity-labelled_bracket_f-score.label: labelled bracket F-score
Entity-labelled_bracket_f-score.description: The labelled bracket F-score is an evaluation metric used to assess the accuracy of syntactic parsing by measuring the overlap of correctly identified brackets in a parsed structure compared to a reference standard.

Entity-negra_corpus.label: NEGRA corpus
Entity-negra_corpus.description: The NEGRA corpus is a linguistically annotated dataset of German texts used for natural language processing and linguistic research.

Entity-interplay.label: interplay
Entity-interplay.description: The term 'interplay' refers to the relationship and interaction between the smoothing techniques and the parsing results in the context of an unlexicalized parser for German.

Entity-previously_reported_result.label: previously reported results
Entity-previously_reported_result.description: The term 'previously reported results' refers to the performance metrics, specifically the labelled bracket F-scores, achieved by earlier studies on the NEGRA corpus prior to the findings presented in this paper.

Entity-parsing_result.label: parsing results
Entity-parsing_result.description: Parsing results refer to the outcomes or outputs generated by a parsing process, which analyzes and interprets the structure of a given input, typically in the context of natural language processing.

Entity-high_accuracy_of_the_model.label: high accuracy of the model
Entity-high_accuracy_of_the_model.description: The high accuracy of the model refers to the degree to which a predictive model correctly identifies or predicts outcomes compared to the actual results.

Entity-accuracy.label: accuracy
Entity-accuracy.description: Accuracy is a performance measure used to evaluate the correctness of a model's predictions compared to the actual outcomes.

summary: In this paper , we present an unlexicalized parser for German which employs smoothing and suffix analysis to achieve a labelled bracket F-score of 76.2 , higher than previously reported results on the NEGRA corpus . In addition to the high accuracy of the model , the use of smoothing in an unlexicalized parser allows us to better examine the interplay between smoothing and parsing results .

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: The predicate 'presents' indicates that the subject is introducing, showcasing, or offering information, findings, or concepts related to the object. It implies a formal or structured communication of the object, which often involves explaining its significance, functionality, or relevance in a particular context.

Predicate-employs.label: employs
Predicate-employs.description: The predicate 'employs' indicates that the subject utilizes or applies the object as a method, technique, or tool in order to achieve a specific purpose or function. It establishes a relationship where the subject actively incorporates the object into its processes or operations.

Predicate-achieves.label: achieves
Predicate-achieves.description: The predicate 'achieves' indicates a successful attainment or accomplishment of a specific goal or outcome by the subject, which is typically a process, system, or entity. The object represents the measurable result or target that is reached, highlighting the effectiveness or performance of the subject in relation to the defined criteria.

Predicate-is.label: is
Predicate-is.description: The predicate 'is' serves as a linking verb that establishes an identity or equivalence between the subject and the object. It indicates that the subject possesses the quality, characteristic, or value represented by the object, effectively defining or describing the subject in relation to the object.

Predicate-is_used_in.label: is used in
Predicate-is_used_in.description: The predicate 'is used in' indicates a functional relationship where the subject serves a role or purpose within the context of the object. It implies that the subject contributes to, supports, or is applied within the framework or operation of the object, suggesting a practical application or relevance of the subject in the domain represented by the object.

Predicate-allows_to_examine.label: allows to examine
Predicate-allows_to_examine.description: The predicate 'allows to examine' indicates that the subject provides the capability or opportunity to investigate, analyze, or study the object. It suggests that the subject facilitates a process of observation or inquiry into the characteristics, relationships, or dynamics represented by the object.

Predicate-interplays_with.label: interplays with
Predicate-interplays_with.description: The predicate 'interplays with' indicates a dynamic and reciprocal relationship between the subject and the object, suggesting that both elements influence and affect each other in a significant way. This interplay can involve mutual enhancement, modification, or interaction, where changes in one can lead to corresponding changes in the other, highlighting a complex interdependence.

Predicate-has.label: has
Predicate-has.description: The predicate 'has' indicates a possessive relationship between the subject and the object, signifying that the subject possesses, contains, or is characterized by the attributes or qualities represented by the object. In this context, it establishes a connection where the subject is associated with the specific property or feature described by the object.

Predicate-are_compared_to.label: are compared to
Predicate-are_compared_to.description: The predicate 'are compared to' establishes a relationship where the subject is evaluated or analyzed in relation to the object, highlighting similarities, differences, or a benchmark. This comparison often aims to assess the quality, performance, or characteristics of the subject by juxtaposing it with the object, which serves as a reference point.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates a hierarchical relationship where the subject represents a specific instance or concept that falls under a more general category or concept represented by the object. This relationship suggests that the subject is a subset or a specific example of the broader category denoted by the object, thereby establishing a connection that reflects the inclusion of the subject within the wider context of the object.
